prompt_template.description: Extract [head entity, verb, tail entity] triples from CoNLL-U dependency tree
prompt_template.system: You are a CoNLL-U-to-triple extractor. Output CSV only, no prose.
prompt_template.human:
Task: Extract every [head, verb, tail] triple from the CoNLL-U below.\nRules:\n1. verb = (a) UPOS=VERB or (b) lemma='be' with dep=cop or (c) token='prevention' with dep=root (nominal predicate) or (d) concatenate every token that depends on the verb via aux/aux:pass (in linear order, space-separated) directly before the verb to form the final verb phrase.
2. head = full surface string of all tokens recursively linked to verb by nsubj (keep original order, include det/amod/compound/conj/punct inside the phrase).
3. tail = full surface string linked to verb by obj/iobj/obl/nmod/attr or their left modifiers (amod, compound, det, etc.) plus any conj/punct, for copula, the nominal parent of 'be' (dep=parataxis also allowed).
4. Output csv format with | delimiter: 
head entity1 | verb1 | tail entity1
head entity2 | verb2 | tail entity2
...
5. Return only the list, no extra text.
- **Do not add any introductory sentences like "Here is the output..."

CoNLL-U:
{tree}
